com.heaton.bot
Class SpiderDone

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.heaton.bot.SpiderDone
class SpiderDone
extends java.lang.Object

This is a very simple object that allows the spider to determine when it is done. This object implements a simple lock that the spider class can wait on to determine completion. Done is defined as the spider having no more work to complete. Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

Field Summary
private  int _activeThreads
          The number of SpiderWorker object threads that are currently working on something.
private  boolean _started
          This boolean keeps track of if the very first thread has started or not.

          This method can be called to block the current thread until the spider is done.

Field Detail

_activeThreads

private int _activeThreads
The number of SpiderWorker object threads that are currently working on something.

_started

private boolean _started
This boolean keeps track of if the very first thread has started or not. This prevents this object from falsely reporting that the spider is done, just because the first thread has not yet started.
Constructor Detail

SpiderDone

SpiderDone()
Method Detail

waitDone

public void waitDone()
This method can be called to block the current thread until the spider is done.

waitBegin

public void waitBegin()
Called to wait for the first thread to start. Once this method returns the spidering process has begun.

workerBegin

public void workerBegin()
Called by a SpiderWorker object to indicate that it has begun working on a workload.

workerEnd

public void workerEnd()
Called by a SpiderWorker object to indicate that it has completed a workload.

reset

public void reset()
Called to reset this object to its initial state.
